title.narrative: 3.2. HYGIENE AND SANITATION PRACTICES

description.narrative: 3.2 Additional Households, in 685 peri-urban and rural communities, have knowledge and able to alleviate harmful hygiene and sanitation practices and norms that impact on their health, which contributes to Hygiene, Sanitation. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: More communities use sustained Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services and are empowered to stop harmful sanitation and hygiene behaviours.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.2 Additional Households, in 685 peri-urban and rural communities, have knowledge and able to alleviate harmful hygiene andsanitation practices and norms that impact on their health

description.narrative: Through abandoning open defecation accompanied by routine handwashing with soap at critical times, an estimated 61,200 people, in 612 communities have lesser harmful hygiene and sanitation practices that impact their health. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:22/12/2016

title.narrative: of additional schools with active hygiene clubs
of additional villages/ communities self-declared ODF
Communities certified free of open defecation in the reporting year only as a result of UNICEF direct support
The proportion of targeted caregivers routinely washing hand with soap and clean water at critical times increases by 60%
